workflow.name: Generate AI inventory reorder recommendations from Airtable with GPT-4o, Slack and email
workflow.description:
## üìò Description
This workflow automates end-to-end AI-driven inventory intelligence, transforming Airtable stock data into optimized reorder recommendations, daily operational summaries, and instant Slack alerts.
 It fetches all inventory rows, validates structure, computes reorder and safety-stock metrics using strict formulas, merges multi-batch AI output into a unified dataset, and distributes actionable insights across Email and Slack.
Invalid or corrupted Airtable rows are logged to Google Sheets for audit and cleanup.
 The workflow ensures deterministic inventory math (zero improvisation), strict JSON compliance, and reliable multi-channel reporting for operations teams.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Manual Trigger ‚Äì Start Inventory Optimization
 Runs the full optimization and reporting pipeline on demand.

üì¶ Fetch Inventory Records from Airtable
 Retrieves all SKU records (ID, ItemName, SKU, quantities, reorder levels) from the Airtable Inventory table.

üîç Validate Inventory Record Structure (IF)
 Ensures each record contains a valid id.
 Valid ‚Üí routed to AI optimization
 Invalid ‚Üí saved to Google Sheets.

üìÑ Log Invalid Inventory Rows to Google Sheet
 Captures malformed or incomplete Airtable items for audit checks and data hygiene.

üß† Configure GPT-4o ‚Äî Inventory Optimization Model
 Defines the AI model for stock-level calculations using strict formulas:
SuggestedReorderPoint = ReorderLevel √ó 1.2
SuggestedSafetyStock = ReorderLevel √ó 0.5
 StockStatus logic:
Critical if QuantityInStock ‚â§ SuggestedSafetyStock
Needs Reorder if QuantityInStock ‚â§ SuggestedReorderPoint
OK otherwise

ü§ñ Generate Inventory Optimization Output (AI)
 The AI engine analyzes each SKU and returns:
Suggested reorder point
Suggested safety stock
Updated stock status
Clean structured JSON for each item
 All without markdown, hallucination, or additional logic.

üß© Merge AI Optimization Results (Code)
 Consolidates all partial AI responses into one complete JSON dataset containing all SKUs.

üß† Configure GPT-4o ‚Äì Email Summary Model
 Prepares the AI model used for generating a professional operations-team email.

üìß Generate Inventory Email Summary (AI)
 Creates a manager-ready email including:
High-level inventory health
Detailed SKU summaries
Alerts for low, reorder-level, or critical stock
Recommended actions for today‚Äôs operations

üì® Email Inventory Summary to Manager (Gmail)
 Sends the completed inventory summary to the operations manager.

üß† Configure GPT-4o ‚Äì Slack Summary Model
 Sets up GPT-4o to produce a compact, emoji-supported Slack summary.

üí¨ Generate Inventory Slack Summary (AI)
 Builds a Slack-optimized message containing:
One-line inventory health
Bullet list of SKUs with stock status
Clear alerts for reorder-level or critical items
One recommended action line

üì° Notify Operations Team on Slack
 Delivers the optimized Slack summary to the operations Slack user/channel for real-time visibility.

## üß© Prerequisites
- Airtable access token
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4o credentials
- Google Sheets OAuth
- Slack API credentials
- Gmail OAuth

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úî AI-powered stock calculations with strict formulas
 ‚úî Reliable reorder and safety-stock predictions
 ‚úî Instant multi-channel reporting (Email + Slack)
 ‚úî Full audit logging for invalid data
 ‚úî Zero hallucinations‚Äîpure structured JSON
 ‚úî Faster decision-making for operations teams

## üë• Perfect For
- Operations & supply-chain teams
- Inventory managers
- Retail & e-commerce units
- Businesses using Airtable for stock tracking

workflow.name: Automate Inventory Reordering from Airtable using GPT-4o, Slack & Email

nodes.name: Log Invalid Inventory Rows to Google Sheet

options.systemMessage:
=Analyze the following Airtable inventory records and return the optimized stock details.

Input Data:
{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

Return ONLY this JSON structure:

{
  "results": [
    {
      "id": "...",
      "ItemName": "...",
      "SKU": "...",
      "QuantityInStock": number,
      "ReorderLevel": number,
      "SuggestedReorderPoint": number,
      "SuggestedSafetyStock": number,
      "StockStatus": "OK | Needs Reorder | Critical"
    }
  ]
}


Important:
- NEVER wrap the output in backticks.
- NEVER include markdown.
- Return ONLY raw JSON.
- The final output MUST be a valid JSON object. 
You are an Inventory Optimization Engine.
Follow formulas strictly and NEVER improvise:

Formula 1:
SuggestedReorderPoint = ReorderLevel * 1.2

Formula 2:
SuggestedSafetyStock = ReorderLevel * 0.5

Rules:
- DO NOT round values unless needed.
- DO NOT swap the formulas.
- DO NOT invent new logic.
- Only use the formulas exactly as written.

StockStatus:
- "Critical" if QuantityInStock <= SuggestedSafetyStock
- "Needs Reorder" if QuantityInStock <= SuggestedReorderPoint
- "OK" otherwise

Return ONLY raw JSON.

parameters.text:
=Generate an operations-team‚Äìready email summary based on the following inventory optimization results:

{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

The email must include:
- A clear subject line
- A short overview of today‚Äôs inventory health
- A bullet list highlighting:
    - Item name
    - SKU
    - Quantity in stock
    - Reorder level
    - Suggested reorder point
    - Suggested safety stock
    - Stock status
- Specific alerts for items:
    - Below reorder level
    - Below safety stock
    - Low stock or critical stock
- A closing section with recommended actions

Keep the tone professional but simple.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert Operations Assistant responsible for generating clear, concise, and actionable email summaries based on inventory optimization data. 

Your job:
- Read the inventory items and their updated stock calculations.
- Identify any SKUs that need attention.
- Highlight items that are nearing reorder point, below safety stock, or have critical status.
- Summarize important updates for the operations team in a professional business email format.
- Keep tone: concise, objective, and action-oriented.
- DO NOT rewrite or change inventory numbers; use exactly what is provided.
- DO NOT add fictional items or assumptions.
- If all items are healthy, still provide an email confirming "No issues detected".

Format the email as:
1. Subject line
2. Greeting
3. Summary paragraph
4. Bullet list of key items with issues
5. Recommended next steps
6. Closing

parameters.text:
=Generate a Slack-friendly inventory summary using the following data:

{{ JSON.stringify($json, null, 2) }}

Include:
- One-line overall inventory health message
- A compact bullet list of items (name, SKU, stock, reorder level, suggestions, status)
- Highlight items that are:
   - Below reorder level
   - Below safety stock
   - Low or critical stock
- Use emojis for quick visibility (‚ö†Ô∏è üî¥ üü¢)
- End with a single recommended Ops action line

Keep it short and actionable.

Include:
- One-line overall inventory health message
- A compact bullet list of items (name, SKU, stock, reorder level, suggestions, status)
- Highlight items that are:
   - Below reorder level
   - Below safety stock
   - Low or critical stock
- Use emojis for quick visibility (‚ö†Ô∏è üî¥ üü¢)
- End with a single recommended Ops action line

Keep it short and actionable.

nodes.name: Notify Operations Team on Slack
nodes.notes: Sends formatted notification to #product-faqs channel with FAQ summary, category, and links

parameters.content:
## üì¶ Automate Inventory Reordering from Airtable using GPT-4o, Slack & Email
This workflow automates inventory intelligence using Airtable + AI models to generate 
optimized stock metrics, and delivers actionable summaries through Email and Slack.

The workflow starts with a manual trigger ‚Üí fetches Inventory from Airtable ‚Üí validates 
each row ‚Üí uses GPT-4o to calculate reorder points, safety stock, and stock health using 
strict formulas. Multiple AI outputs are merged into one consolidated dataset. Using the 
optimized results, the system generates two types of summaries: a professional email for 
operations managers and a compact Slack message for quick team visibility.

Invalid rows are logged into Google Sheets to maintain audit-readiness. The workflow ensures 
zero hallucinations, strict JSON formatting, accurate stock-health status, and consistent 
multi-channel communication. This enables the operations team to instantly identify low, 
critical, or reorder-level items and take action on time.

Tools used:
‚Ä¢ Airtable ‚Üí Inventory source  
‚Ä¢ GPT-4o (Azure) ‚Üí Optimization + Email summary  
‚Ä¢ GPT-4o (Azure) ‚Üí Slack summary  
‚Ä¢ Google Sheets ‚Üí Invalid record logging  
‚Ä¢ Slack ‚Üí Ops team alert  
‚Ä¢ Gmail ‚Üí Email to Manager  

Overall, this workflow ensures clean intake, strict validation, accurate AI-based 
optimization, and multi-channel actionable reporting.

## Intake & Validation Block

This section handles data import and quality checks:
‚Ä¢ Pulls inventory from Airtable  
‚Ä¢ Validates required fields (id)  
‚Ä¢ Routes invalid rows to Google Sheets for auditing  
‚Ä¢ Only clean data enters the AI computation phase

## AI Optimization Engine

This block processes inventory rows using GPT-4o:
‚Ä¢ Applies fixed formulas for reorder point & safety stock  
‚Ä¢ Computes stock health status  
‚Ä¢ Ensures strict JSON output (no markdown, no hallucinations)  
‚Ä¢ Merges multiple model outputs into one consolidated dataset

## Email Summary Generation

Creates a professional, actionable inventory report:
‚Ä¢ Overall stock health  
‚Ä¢ Low/critical SKU alerts  
‚Ä¢ Recommended next steps  
‚Ä¢ Delivered via Gmail to the manager

## Slack Summary Generation

Produces a compact, emoji-friendly inventory status message:
‚Ä¢ One-line health indicator  
‚Ä¢ Item-wise stock highlights  
‚Ä¢ Critical/reorder alerts (üü¢ ‚ö†Ô∏è üî¥)  
‚Ä¢ Auto-sent to the Ops Slack user/channel

parameters.message: =üö® *Workflow Error Alert*  *Error Node:* {{ $json.node.name }} *Error Message:* {{ $json.error.message }} *Timestamp:* {{ $now.toISO() }}  Please investigate immediately.
parameters.subject: Workflow Error Alert

parameters.content:
## Error Handling
Sends alerts when the workflow fails

nodes.name: Log Trade Decision to Notion (inventory db)
Create Asana Task for Inventory Db

parameters.content:
## üîê Required Credentials
- Airtable (Inventory source)
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o)
- Google Sheets (audit logging)
- Slack API (Ops alerts)
- Gmail OAuth2 (email summaries)
- Notion API (inventory records)
- Asana OAuth2 (task creation)

Use n8n credentials. Never hard-code API keys.

## üóÇÔ∏è Task & Record Logging
Logs inventory decisions for traceability and action.
Creates tasks in Asana and stores optimized records
inside a Notion inventory database.

main.node: Create Asana Task for Inventory Db
Log Trade Decision to Notion (inventory db)
Log Invalid Inventory Rows to Google Sheet

user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
